title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 33.3 - Lists of equipment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 33.3 - Lists of equipment

State Regulations

Every county and town superintendent shall, on or before July
1st of every year, submit to the commissioner a list of all equipment owned by
the county or town, and under the direction and control of the county or town
superintendent, which is capable of being used for or aiding in the cleanup and
removal of discharges of petroleum. Such equipment lists shall contain, but not
be limited to: backhoes; boats; booms, skimmers and other specialized equipment
for the removal of petroleum; bulldozers; gradalls; graders; scrapers; tractors
and trucks. Lists shall be submitted to the commissioner at the following
address: Oil Spill Prevention and Control Bureau

Waterways Maintenance Subdivision

New York State Department of Transportation
1220 Washington Avenue

Building 5, State Campus

Albany, NY 12232

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
